import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd 
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
sns.set(rc={'figure.figsize': (15,13)})
import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))
source.fd901c31:
paypal = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/fintech-stock-price-data/Fintech Stocks.xlsx', 
                       sheet_name='PayPal', index_col=0, engine='openpyxl')
paypal.head()
source.3f63c380:
paypal['dail_ var'] = ((paypal['Adj Close']-paypal['daily_mean'])**2)/(len(paypal.index)-1)
paypal['daily_std'] = np.sqrt(paypal['dail_ var'])
paypal
source.de7a5db9:
# Plotting Paypal price vs. price variances
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(25, 10))
gs = fig.add_gridspec(1, 2, hspace=0.2, wspace=0.2)
(ax1, ax2) = gs.subplots(sharex=False, sharey=False)
fig.suptitle(' Daily PayPal Adj. Close Price vs Price Variance')

sns.lineplot(ax=ax1, data=paypal, x = 'Date', y='Adj Close')
sns.lineplot(ax=ax2, data=paypal, x = 'Date', y='daily_std')
plt.show()
source.32716e82:
affirm = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/fintech-stock-price-data/Fintech Stocks.xlsx', 
                       sheet_name='Affirm', index_col=0, engine='openpyxl')
coinbase = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/fintech-stock-price-data/Fintech Stocks.xlsx', 
                       sheet_name='Coinbase', index_col=0, engine='openpyxl')
fiserv = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/fintech-stock-price-data/Fintech Stocks.xlsx', 
                       sheet_name='Fiserv', index_col=0, engine='openpyxl')
square = pd.read_excel('/kaggle/input/fintech-stock-price-data/Fintech Stocks.xlsx', 
                       sheet_name='Square', index_col=0, engine='openpyxl')
source.cef04d37:
# Plotting other fintech stocks
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(25, 12))
gs = fig.add_gridspec(2, 2, hspace=0.2, wspace=0.2)
(ax1, ax2), (ax3, ax4) = gs.subplots(sharex=False, sharey=False)
fig.suptitle('5-year Fintech Stock Performance')

sns.lineplot(ax=ax1, data=affirm, x = 'Date', y='Adj Close')
ax1.title.set_text('Affirm')

sns.lineplot(ax=ax2, data=coinbase, x = 'Date', y='Adj Close')
ax2.title.set_text('Coinbase')

sns.lineplot(ax=ax3, data=fiserv, x = 'Date', y='Adj Close')
ax3.title.set_text('Fiserv')

sns.lineplot(ax=ax4, data=square, x = 'Date', y='Adj Close')
ax4.title.set_text('Square')
plt.show()
source.f203d065: # Importing datasets of other fintech stocks
source.a8fca7e5: ### Even in light of the gread variability in prices, Paypal held quite well and trippled in a matter of 12 months going from under 100 to levels above 300 dollars. With the pandemic pushing everyone back home, e-commerce and its direct/indirect industry complements such as digital payments/loans facilitated transactions and the likes. PayPal and other fintech companies (as will observe later) bank on this opportunity.
